= Get Concept Strip

Source: R/format.R
get_strip.Rd

= Get Concept Strip

get_strip(concept_id, vocab_schema = "omop_vocabulary", conn)

See also

select

Examples

library(tidyverse)
library(chariot)

get_strip(concept_id = 1112807,
         vocab_schema = "omop_vocabulary")

#> [2020-12-12 11:12:50]	Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> ✓ Connection is open
#> ✓ Connection is JDBC Connection
#> [1] "[V] [S] 1112807 aspirin [RxNorm 1191] [Drug] [Ingredient]"

test_strip <- tibble::tibble(concept = "[V] [S] 1112807 aspirin [RxNorm 1191] [Drug] [Ingredient]")
unmerge_strip(test_strip,
              strip_col = concept)

#> # A tibble: 1 x 8
#>   concept_id concept_name domain_id vocabulary_id concept_class_id
#>   <chr>      <chr>        <chr>     <chr>         <chr>           
#> 1 1112807    aspirin      Drug      RxNorm        Ingredient      
#> # … with 3 more variables: standard_concept <chr>, concept_code <chr>,
#> #   invalid_reason <chr>

test_data <-
        queryAthena("SELECT * FROM omop_vocabulary.concept ORDER BY RANDOM() LIMIT 20;",
                    cache_only = TRUE)

#> [2020-12-12 11:12:50]	Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
#> ✓ Connection is open
#> ✓ Connection is JDBC Connection
#> [2020-12-12 11:12:50]	Loading Cache...
#> [2020-12-12 11:12:50]	Cached SQL: SELECT * FROM omop_vocabulary.concept ORDER BY RANDOM() LIMIT 20;
#> [2020-12-12 11:12:50]	Cached resultset found...
#> [2020-12-12 11:12:50]	Postgres connection closed
merge_strip(test_data,
            into = "concept")
